item.title: Fernando Mendoza Officially Declares for 2026 NFL Draft
item.author: Nick B.
item.description: Heisman Trophy winner and Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza announces his decision to enter the NFL Draft, ending speculation about his future.
item.content:encoded:
Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza, the 2025 Heisman Trophy winner and architect of one of the most remarkable turnarounds in college football history, has officially declared for the 2026 NFL Draft.

Mendoza's decision was widely expected after leading the Hoosiers to the Big Ten Championship and a berth in the College Football Playoff. He threw for 4,283 yards, 41 touchdowns, and just 8 interceptions while completing 72.3% of his passes.

The 6'5", 225-pound signal-caller is the consensus top prospect in this year's draft class and is expected to be the first overall selection by the Las Vegas Raiders.

item.title: Is Arvell Reese the Best Defensive Prospect Since Micah Parsons?
item.author: Draft Analyst
item.description: Breaking down what makes the Ohio State linebacker special and why scouts are comparing him to the Cowboys superstar.
item.content:encoded:
When Ohio State linebacker Arvell Reese declared for the 2026 NFL Draft, it set off a wave of excitement throughout the scouting community. The junior's combination of size, speed, and instinct has drawn comparisons to some of the best defensive players to come out of college in recent memory.

Reese's production backs up the measurables. In 2025, he recorded 94 tackles, 12.5 sacks, 3 interceptions, and 2 forced fumbles.

The comparison to Micah Parsons isn't made lightly. Like Parsons, Reese played multiple positions in college, lining up as an edge rusher, off-ball linebacker, and even slot corner.

item.title: Jeremiyah Love Stock Rising After Pro Day Performance
item.author: Nick B.
item.description: Notre Dame running back showed elite athleticism at his pro day, running a 4.42 40-yard dash and posting a 38-inch vertical jump.
item.content:encoded:
Notre Dame running back Jeremiyah Love may have cemented himself as the RB1 of the 2026 draft class with an outstanding pro day performance Wednesday.

Love, who measured 5'11" and 205 pounds, ran an official 4.42-second 40-yard dash and posted a 38-inch vertical jump - numbers that would have ranked among the best at the position had he run them at the Combine.

The performance has reportedly caught the attention of several teams with first-round picks, including the New York Jets at No. 2 and the Cleveland Browns at No. 6.

item.title: NFL Combine 2026: Top Prospects Announced
item.author: Staff Writer
item.description: The NFL has released the full list of 324 invited players for the 2026 NFL Scouting Combine in Indianapolis.
item.content:encoded:
The NFL announced today the 324 players invited to participate in the 2026 NFL Scouting Combine, which will be held February 27 through March 8 at Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis.

Headliners include Heisman winner Fernando Mendoza (QB, Indiana), edge rusher Rueben Bain Jr. (Miami), offensive tackle Francis Mauigoa (Miami), and cornerback Jermod McCoy (Tennessee).

The event will follow its traditional format, with on-field workouts beginning March 1.

item.title: Scout: Arvell Reese is "Best Defensive Player in This Class"
item.author: Nick B.
item.description: An anonymous NFC scout shared their thoughts on the Ohio State linebacker, saying he compares favorably to past top-5 picks.
item.content:encoded:
Multiple scouts and executives have praised the junior's tape, but one NFC area scout didn't hold back when asked about Reese's ceiling.

"He's the best defensive player in this class, and it's not particularly close," the scout said. "I haven't seen a linebacker with his combination of size, speed, and instincts since Micah Parsons."

Reese is currently projected as a top-5 pick, with several teams reportedly very interested.

item.title: Why the Raiders Must Take Mendoza at No. 1
item.author: Nick B.
item.description: An opinion piece on why Las Vegas cannot afford to pass on the Heisman winner with the first overall pick.
item.content:encoded:
The Las Vegas Raiders have the first overall pick in the 2026 NFL Draft for the first time in franchise history. And there's only one right answer: Fernando Mendoza.

The Raiders' quarterback room is arguably the worst in football. They don't have a single player under contract who should be starting in the NFL next season.

Mendoza isn't just the best quarterback in this class; he's one of the best prospects to come out in the last decade. His 72.3% completion percentage is the highest ever for a Heisman winner.

item.title: Film Room: Breaking Down Rueben Bain Jr.'s Tape
item.author: Film Room Staff
item.description: Scouting report and film analysis of Miami edge rusher Rueben Bain Jr., projected top-10 pick.
item.content:encoded:
In the latest edition of our Film Room series, we break down Miami edge rusher Rueben Bain Jr., one of the most productive pass rushers in college football last season.

Bain recorded 11.5 sacks and 18.5 tackles for loss in 2025, earning First-Team All-ACC honors.

Bain's first-step quickness is elite. He consistently beats offensive tackles off the snap, forcing them into recovery mode immediately.

Current projection: Top 10 pick.
